result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshaunte M Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Fine of $1,000.00 or 50 hours of community service to be paid by August 21, 2015.  Court waived court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges due to lack of income.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  Also advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
Pay DNA surcharge.  To be paid by August 21, 2015.  Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deshaunte M Adams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered defendant to serve 3 DAYS  in the House of Correction;  with 3 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $1000.00 or 50 hours of community service to be paid by August 21, 2015. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court waived court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, due to lack of income. 
- Defendant to pay DNA surcharge, to be paid in full by August 21, 2015. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Deshaunte M Adams in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated May 20, 2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Deshaunte M Adams in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 Defense counsel received discovery and offer. Any motions to be filed by 05-21-2015 at 8:30 am.  Court orders case for adjourned projected Plea and Sentencing on 5-21-2015 at 8:30, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report  dated April 20, 2015, received and filed. tk

Defendant Deshaunte M Adams in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Ron Dague for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/3/15.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Deshaunte M Adams in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Deshaunte M Adams in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge STARK, Branch 17.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
